alert.note: Alert for Blount; Cocke (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 01 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Blount, Cocke, Hamblen, Jefferson, Knox, Loudon, Monroe and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Morristown, Maryville, Sevierville, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Jefferson City, Newport, Sweetwater, Loudon, Madisonville, Gatlinburg, Dandridge, Pigeon Forge, Louisville, White Pine, New Market, Rockford, Baneberry and Parrottsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
